reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is pretty good for an early access game and as it stands I would recommend it.

You play as a tree...called tree :). Who sets out on a journey across a beautiful hand drawn world to put an end to the Florps evil reign. Sounds pretty cool right?

The core of the game is simple. It is a side scrolling game with simple jump,fight and interaction mechanics.

It offers a limited customisation aspect with head,weapon and side arm gear. Although it does give you damage stats for different weapons (and there seems to be a few different weapons) so you don't have to stick with one weapon all the way trhough the game. Furthermore head gear also gives you extra stats such as long sprint or more regen from food etc.

It has a small aspect of survival with a food bar below your health bar. Keeping an eye on these two bars is essential and you need to make sure you have food on you at all times! Or you will suffer. You can even hire a fellow town member for 10 gold pieces to go out and scavenge food for you! So that is always a last resort!

You can pick up quests from fellow trees who will offer you rewards if you complete them.  At the moment they seem pretty simple. Go out and grab a certain number of the item and bring them back for a reward. Im hoping eventually they may be qeusts to kill certain monsters etc that would be a nice addition if it isn't in the game already. You can even ally with different races to help you in the fight against the enemy!!

The game also does not tell you where to go, what to do or how to do it. So it is all up to you to figure it out. This could be annoying for some people but that satisfaction when you finally figure out how to accomplish something is a damn good feeling :). It took me ages to figure out at one point how to get to the next mountain area urghhh ha.

Hedghogs/spiky frogs are the hardest enemies on the game ha! Do not land on top of them or they will kill you within a few hits! A tree being killed by a hedgehog/frog haha amazing!!

As is stands it is playable and enjoyable but can be frustrating at times when you have no idea where to go! But hey thats the fun of the adventure right?? trying to figure out what to do! I would definitely recommend this if you like side scrolling games with a nice story, a beautiful hand drawn world, nice and simple fighting mechanics and trying to figure out where and what the hell to do!

Here is a link to a video on my channel where I show you guys some gameplay footage hope you enjoy!!

I also want to add. The developers of this game are awesome! Very helpful, update the game when needed and all round are nice developers!!

https://youtu.be/11UprbZzV4k

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First 1.5 Hours Impressions
So I played for an hour and a half and kept notes on what I was experiencing and things I liked and didn't like, I figured I'd share these notes with you (the developer) for some quick hints on how to patch up next, and how a new player like myself may experience your game (which hopefully gives you a good idea how to make future changes). This is mostly for the developer, but if you're thinking of purchasing this game go ahead and read through my notes. Warning: this will be length, but hopefully helpful.


Gameplay Notesvery professional-feeling intro
upgrading stats is cool, I like the design
i got three-shot by a porcupine 10 minutes into game, this better not be one of those games where the difficulty is ALL over the place. i was too tall to hit him
i really like how this looks like a much less serious and concrete game from the outside, but it does indeed have basically all the features most RPG's have
the Minecraft-styled Furnace is a neat touch
dialogue is pretty funny
my only complaint as of yet is the combat, it's very loose and sometimes (like the porcupine) downright unfair, how do i hit him? he's too damn short (edit: I think I figured it out, he's not killable, just jump over him...)
i love quests, don't get me wrong, i actually love the grindy ones where you just collect a few things and return, but i feel like i got bombarded with quests immediately, that may overwhelm some players
day-night cycle was unexpected and very cool
immedaitely noticed how the inventory is too small, especially with 10 different collect quests at a time
it'd be nice if the movement was a bit quicker, seeing as there's lots of backtracking to be done, or maybe if sprint regenerated faster; at this rate i'll be wasting Upgrade Points on speed (edit: upgraded map negates backtracking nicely)
some of the quests consist of just waiting and picking the twigs once they respawn, since I'm not strong enough to explore anywhere else
the fast travel options make the slow walking speed much more bearable
the stat page should pause the game, I'm fine with the map or inventory being open while the game is playing but the stat page should be safe
why don't the boars fight back?
should've been a sign pointing left from my house, I thought I could only go right (I may just be stupid, too). once you go left THEN this game gets like twice as good, now that there's a village and tons of merchants right next to my house
lots of content, tons of items, expected much less. still just wish the combat was better: maybe it would've worked better if it were turn-based instead
game progresses extremely slowly; might turn new players away
chests should have an auto-deposit" type of feature
date: where you can just stack all the like items in your inventory onto the corresponding ones in the chest\nNOTE TO NEW PLAYERS: the game starts extremely slow
recommended:
once it gets going though it's a lot of fun and much more fleshed out than you may have originally thought!
Aesthetic Notesawesome narrator
button clicks are annoying and too loud
axe sound is weird
hoursPlayed: especially considering i'm only hitting air. also too loud\nso far

reviewText:
My Review for The Adventures of Tree Taking on the role of a formonger named “Tree”, you have to save the island from the evil Florps. There are a number of ways to win, such as to  Defeat the florps leader, make a deal with the florps, join with other species to defeat the florps and many more.

Story 8/10Good Different choices brought more game time and fun
Good Very fun and clever dialogue make this game enjoyable
Bad The florps are not in the game (Only 1 or 2) until you get to the final parts of the map which was annoying because I wanted to see more
Graphics 7/10Good The cartoon like graphics showed happiness and joy but it also knows how to make the enemies look evil and dark
Bad Most of the items are poorly drawn and don’t have any straight lines or symmetry. Sometimes I enjoy that simple drawing but I believe it could have been done better
Gameplay 8/10Good The combat was at first very difficult and I had to spend a bit of time trying to hit the enemy without being hit. But after you master this, the combat is very enjoyable and has a good level of difficulty
Good The weapons and armour had a good variety and each item had different effects to help the player
Bad The quests were basic but many didn’t point me in the right direction and I had to spend quite a lot of time looking around for just one item
Bad The consumable items had a good variety but many of these items (such as poison) had no reason to be in my inventory and there was no quest I could find that wanted that item
NPCs 7/10Good The enemies attacked mostly in close-up and they run towards you when you are close enough but some do attack with range and some enemies just run away. This made sure I didn’t have to repeat the combat over and over again so I had something different all the time
Good The friendly NPCs sold items, gave quests or just random chatter. Each NPC looked different so everyone in the game was different
Bad Some NPCs were hard to find for quests and it would have been useful if they all had names so then the quests were easier, although I do enjoy the difficulty.
Music/Sound 9/10Good The music in the whole game was so fluid and I loved it completely
Good The sound effects of fighting and actions in the game were on average because some sound effects didn’t make sense to me but I did not mind it that much
Good The NPC sound effects were very good and each enemy sounded different so when I couldn’t see the enemy in caves, for example, I could hear the sound of them so I would know what enemy it is
Settings/Configuration 8/10Good Setting the audio was very easy and there were many options
Good Setting the graphics was basic and many of the options are already set perfectly for me to play
Bad There was no difficulty setting so I couldn’t make it a harder/better experience for me
Final RatingThis game gave me a great experience. I only played for 5 hours and I finished the game twice. There are many more decisions I can make when I replay this. Fortunately, the developer is still making this game better and if he just tweaks this game a bit more, it will be amazing. From what I have played in this game, I’m giving it an 8/10 so I recommend this game to people who want a new experience while playing an RPG

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Title: The Adventures of Tree
Genre: Action, Adventure, Indie, RPG, Early Access
Developer: NinjaISV , TigerNDV
Publisher: OfficialTigerStudios
Release Date1 May, 2015

NOTE : THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW

Gameplay
Your trees lived peacefully, just minding their own business until one day, the fire nation attacked.
Okay, maybe not.

Anyway, I was really looking forward to playing this game when I first saw it, because hello, you're a tree, and survival building games are awesome. And straight away, you can select your controls, and customise your tree! You can change the eyes! The mouth! The colour! The voice is awesome! I haven't even started the game and I'm already in love with it.  In fact I'm in danger of exploding with shameless fangirling, which is no good for a person of my age and standing. Nope. Not at all.

The graphics have their own charm. For me, they are so bad/derpy (I mean cute cough) they are brilliant, and no one should ever change them. Ever.
Also, time to eat a hamburger because logic. Never mind you cannibalise trees around you. You're a special sentient tree so it's okay.

Anyway, this game has typical survival features, you need to gather materials, stave off your hunger, collect money to buy upgrades.  You gain money from accepting quests from other trees. You can't really go and accept every quest though because you will lose gold for handing them in late. The combat system pretty much is chop, run, chop. It's limited so that can make it clumsy, it's definitely not a main focus of the game. When you get badly injured though, the blood smears on the sides of the screen are actually a little creepy.

Pros

Graphics are hilarious
You're a tree
The voice acting is pretty cool, so is dialogue
So much customisation!
You can wear random things and be a christmas tree
The way you jump is amazing
The sounds/music

Cons

Cons? What cons?
Okay maybe one, if you die, you lose all your stuff, and if you walk into another area you can't really get it back.
Small inventory aswell since not everything stacks up (twigs only stack to 5)
TL;DR

Overall Verdict
Definitely get this game! It's awesome. That's all you need to know.

If you'd like to read more reviews from me, join my steam group!

reviewText:
Here's my First Impressions & Review video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHGERuSg_Cs

I actually love the hand drawn looking art in this game and think this is a pretty cool little casual RPG that isn't too hardcore, but pretty fun with tons of NPCs, tons of questions, and lots and lots of loot to be had.

You have 3 save slots for up to 3 different game saves or characters to play.  Great for people that might want to allow another member of their house to play the same game and have their own game save slot.

You start off getting to customize your character tree with all kinds of options to make yourself look unique and interesting.  Then you are brought into a huge 2D world with nice hand drawn art and other people and creatures.  Moving your tree avatar to the left or right side of the screen will load in the next screen and if you move with a door just behind you, you can move up (W key) to move through the door as long as it is unlocked.  Items can be accessed and NPCs can be talked to by hitting your E key by default when you move near them.  Attacking a baddie can be done by simply clicking your left mouse button.  Space jumps, and shift allows you to sprint but uses your stamina which will recover over time when you stop sprinting.  Note that all of these keys CAN be customized in the options to what ever you prefer.

I gave this game a 74% out of 100, with most of the points knocked off only because the game I feel is just a little over-priced at it's regular $9.99 USD price tag.  Still, a good score though if you are looking for a casual RPG or perhaps one that might interest and engage children.

Recommended for sure unless you are expecting Skyrim or Dark Souls for your money here.  :-)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

7.5/10 - A Promising Early Access Game

This game is pretty fun, and time gets away from you quick. You are a tree that sets out to restore order to the land. You have your hatchet, outfit and your wits. As you explore the world you find items that are needed to complete the massive amount of quests you receive.

The game has a great art-style, I didn't love the sepia part as much just because it was really difficult to progress and find items. I felt myself just waiting for visible light to be restored. (Find a torch ASAP) If you quit the game with items in your inventory they will disappear, so plan accordingly.

Tons of updates constantly happening. Good vibes from this Early Access Game.

Worth the $8 in anticipation the final product will knock my socks off!

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kls62rkbxsE

The Adventures of Tree is side-scroller, open world, action adventure, where you play as … well, a tree. Your world, an island, is invaded by evil Florps – purple furry creatures and it's up to you to save your people ...um or fellow trees I guess? I play the game for almost 7 h and this is my first impressions.

For a 2D game it have a lot of settings. In the graphics section there are Resolution, Subtitles, Motion Blur, V-sync, Fullscreen and Depth of Field. The game runs smoothly with 60 FPS and you can even play it on Windows XP. Audio options are plenty. There six different sliders – ambient, movie, mob, GUI, music and others. Excelent work! There is full controller support and you can rebind the keys, even for the controller. I didn't try how is the gameplay with him, but I think it's the preferable to play with a controller. Keyboard and mouse work just fine.

I'm not a big fan of the graphic style. It's hand drawn and cute, but I didn't like that much the character models and the world. This is highly subjective and didn't put me off. I really enjoy the game, despite not liking the graphic style that much. The world is vibrant and colorful (and dangerous), even the evil Florps are also kinda cute. Consider this: my favourite game of all time is Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth and the graphics there are bad.

I started the review with the story, so now gameplay is next. As a mentioned it's side scroller action adventure with a big world to explore. You start by creating your character. Then you are free to roam the island, but be careful. You may reach dangerous places before you are strong enough to deal the enemies there and you will die. Then after you respawn you have to go to the place you die to collect your stuff. The first thing you have to know is you have three bars in the top left corner – health, hunger and stamina. So you have to manage them. Food is actually easy to acquire. Around the world there are a lot of fruits and vegetables to eat, but meat is preferable. There are creatures like birds and boars to kill and get raw meat from them. Since it's raw you have to cook it. The food from one type is stacking, so it's doesn't take much space in your invetory. I heavily advise to supply yourself with a lot of meat, because with food not only you replenish your hunger meter, but also your health. Later I found that there are potions.

So this management part is not the only thing you can do. You will fight and do quests. Most of jobs you take are just fetch qustes. But the will lead you to new places and you will have to kill creatures for food or to progress. The fighting is okay. You stabing or you swinging. I know that you can buy bow, but I don't have it yet. So beside him there are a lot of different swords, axes and others weapons with different stats. By doing quests and selling thing, you will get money In almost every villige you have a vendor that sells weapons, shields, glasses, pipes, cigarettes, hats, lanters for light and so on. Everything have some benefit for you like lower hunger or higher jump, so it wise to not sell everything, you never know where your quest will lead you. For example. There is a quest where i had to go high in the mountain, but it's freezing. So you have to find something to keep me warm, because you are constantly loosing life. It's a hat. You don't have the inventory space to carry around everything. You will store your stuff in chests around the island. You can buy more things than those that I mentioned to ease your journey, but you have to see the for yourself.

There is also light RPG system here. When you level up, you get upgrade points to put in 10 different stats. Creatures respawn, so you will fight and gain xp constantly.

Enemies you encounter are very diverce. Spiders, bees, ice hedghogs, slimes and so on. Almsot everyone of them will drop something that you can sell or you need it ot complete a quest. In the description in Steam it's written that it have 50 different creatures and i think i saw until now around the half of them. Also i fought two bosses so far. The first was not too difficult, but the second, a rock monster, killed my a couple of times. They were fun to fight.

The world is big and every place you visit is different. You will go to different villiges, caves, climb a mountain, go through a swamp and so on. There you will see a lot of trees, from which you will get quests. The great thing about the world is that's full of secrets and there is no hand holding. You will see places that can be access only by having some equipmet or something else and you have figure it out what you need. Exploration is required, because you can find stuff you normaly have to pay or expensive things to sell. There are also things you can do that can lead to some strange consequences. Take the money from mill, trust me. There is also fast travel and thank God for that. You have a map and by opening it you can travel to the places you discovered. My advice is to buy a bigger map as soon as posible. It will save you a lot of walking. I don't know if there some consequences, but every night i go to my house and sleep. You can travel while it's night, but if sleeping is implemented here, it must be for some reason.

The sound design is okay. Fx are good, but the music is ... i can't remember a single track. It's there is, fit the fun setting, but it's nothing special. However there is one track that stand out a little bit. When you see a girl with a guitar pay her 20 coins. That is all i'm going to say.

I have one big problem with the game and it's the inventory. When you need to eat, you have to open it, then to click on something and the game doesn't stops. Imagine that when you fight a boss. That is why the rock monster kill at least 7-8 times, because i couldn't heal my self in time. If there is a key just for the food to heal you fast, it would be awesome. Through my time with the game i have encounter few small bugs and one big. The game froze and i have to close it from the task manager. This was just once and the game was still in EA. Also one or two times the game didn't register my hits at all, so i had to restart the game. After it's full release i didn't encounter any of those bugs again.

The game came out of EA on first of March  and it's good to see that it's not abandoned and unfinished. Despite not likeing that much the art style and the rather simplistic combat, i really enjoy the game. It's fun, colorful, offers hours of gameplay, doesn't hold your hand, have a big world explore, secrets to be discovered and it suppose to have different endings based on your choices throughout the game. I recommend it.

reviewText: If you're looking for a relaxing little RPG adventure your search has an end. The story is very short - well, actually there is no real story (except for an intro and an ending clip) - but you have do several quests, earn money for better equipment and skillpoints to beat the game. AND: You can finish the game in different ways! Which brings me to the next good point: It's really fun to gain all the achievements. Some are very easy, some are quite tricky - but after all it's nothing like: Play 1,000,000 hours...\n\nThe price is fair, because: I bought it a month after the release and (apart from the fact that the game was already really fun to play back then) the devs did and still do great work. It is(/was?) their first project and they immediately dealt with your problems and gave you feedback/ updated the game promptly. Also the game is already out of Early Access and they still add free content and quests, so... any more words?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I've to say that the number of hours I have on this game are only from card dropping, and I've never actually opened the game and played for even a single minute.

HOWEVER. This is how Early Access works: this game receives dailys or at least weekly updates; since I got it it kept receiving updates and has never stopped. If you buy this game, you can be sure that this won't be just another Early Access with no updates.

Big ups for the dev(s)!

reviewText:
**EDIT 1**: It is still in development but this review if for it's current state.


I know I used to recommend this game, but as seeing the final release and everything from now on is only going to be bug fixes I have to change it to negative. First off the good is that it's a pretty fun open world rpg where you can go back and forth doing quests. I played a lot of Poptropica as a kid and this game reminded me a lot of it. Now for the negatives;

1. The loading screens- For a pretty simple game I have no idea why it takes to fricken long to load. Not only that but the game freezes for simple stuff like opening your inventory. Seriously, why is this a problem?

2. Combat- Combat is just downright terrible. Which sucks because it plays a pretty big role in the game. It just feels so awkward and un-natural that I don't look forward to any combat I have to do.

Overall it is not a terrible game but it could have been way better at the same time. Get it on sale if you're into these kind of games

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI quite enjoy this game - so don't get me wrong here - but the character moves too slow for my liking. There are still some bugs that need to be fixed. It isn't the easiest to upgrade your character so that he's stronger amongst the beasts you encounter. There are a variety of different characters in this, which is good (even though they all look the same :p) The quests are all fairly basic, although some are more difficult than others to complete due to the game still being in development. It's a basic game but easy to play, which was what I was looking for in a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played this game a bit more after some patches. It is more polished now and also I think that graphics are a bit better than half a year ago.

This is a 2d adventure game where you play as some kind of living tree that goes here and there and explores. There is a levelling system where you have some stats and you can assign points to have more hp or better attack.

I think that the whole point of this game is to make quests and explore the world. The quest are simple - bring 5 carrots, bring 3 apples, so on. For completing quests you gain gold and probably XP.

Combat system is now better than in the previous version as actually you can hit enemies without being overwhelmed by their damage.

All in all the game gets much better with every patch. What is very positive about this game is that developers actually take care in what people are saying about their product and try to implement changes based on feedback into the game.

If you like 2d platformers with some basic quests and basic combat system then you can try this game. I can see that this is a basic game that is playable, but this is just not my cup of tea.

----------
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

reviewText:
It crashes before it finishes loading after the introdution, although it seems quite promising.

Because of this I cannot play the game at all, but the devs have put in a lot of effort in trying to fix the problems, so if you have some issues with the game i assure you that they will work hard to try and fix them.

(I am running it on a Surface Pro 3 256GB i5 with Intel HD Intergrated Graphics 4400)
(if you have a different graphics processor it should work fine)

I don't really know whether to recommend or not recommend:
- I can't run it
but
- devs worked hard to try and fix my issue
and
- it works fine on other computers

so...

I'll recommend it to others who don't have a surface pro 3 with Intel HD Graphics 4400

(If someone gets it to work with a surface pro 3 let me know if u did anything special to get it to work.)
